intro: Leucadendron spicatum, commonly known as the silver leaf leucadendron, is a South African shrub belonging to the Proteaceae family. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and striking, cone-shaped inflorescences that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with dry summers. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its unique appearance and drought tolerance. Leucadendron spicatum plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators.
